content:
er 16, 2015
												I played this game on EAST server for few hundered hrs since 2012. (been quitting and returning). So I've seen how this game was, has been going and how it is now.While I like the non target battles and exciting background music and all, this game is NOT NEWBIE FRIENDLY AT ALL.Like most other rpg games, "everything starts from max lvl (90)." But way to get there from scratch is total nightmare.DO NOT START unless u have a friend who is already playing this game that can support you otherwise you'll have to cover it with insane grinding. Not many people playing the early stages so if you start fresh you'll mostly play solo or need to get help from higher level players. Not much chance to earn golds before level 60 and equipment inflation price starts from lvl 70 so hopefully you get lucky loots in between and earn some 'enchant scrolls' which can get you few million golds to cover the equipment prices.For level 70+ dungeons you'll need to enhance/enchant your equipments but both processes are heavily dependant on random chances (can destroy your equipments if you fail). If you don't want to destory ur items, you'll have to buy "runes" with cash that prevents destruction when enchant/enhance fails.lvl 80 equipments are so expensive (10~20million golds PER PIECE / 1 weapon + 5 armors) that people try to skip that and get lvl 90 equipments which are cheaper; which means you'll have to risk enhancing/enchanting your lvl70 gear even more (and possilbly destroy) to advance to higher lvl dungeons or keep grinding the same dungeon over and over for lvl 70-90 section.(you must enhance otherwise your ATT will be too low and people won't accept you to thier party)If you complain/wonder about such inflated prices of high lvl stuff, horde of old users will rush to you shivering their fat chins and preaching about supply/demand. Well, the sad truth is that this game was once overrun by so many BOTs that spammed billions worth of golds/items with hacks. Most of bots are now banned but spammed gold remains (and people also buy golds from gold trading websites) + there aren't any end game content that makes users to spend chunk of gold DIRECTLY. Therefore those golds keep cycling amongst high lvl users inflating item prices more and more.What is even more sad is that old users are actually promoting these bubbles and justify it saying "well, you can earn hundred millions if u get lucky" = join-the-league-or-gtfo logic. Result? no new players, same people everyday, not enough matchings for dungeons.... yay! :DThere are no devs in this game. Every single patches, policies and events come from KR HQ and they don't approve much changes unless theres some serious bugs/errors. What NA team do here is just translate -> test -> deploy and they are so good at that job that whenever there is a major patch, people suffer from bugs/random disconnection/client crashes.Plus your feedback is completely ignored becuase NA team don't have any power to change anything. (Feedback forum is just there to look good)

												Discredit all under 100 hours reviews. I'm aware of 500,000+ ♥♥♥♥♥♥ flaws this game has to offer. THIS IS FREE TO PLAY KOREAN MMOdo not play unless you feel like enduring the grindI hated this game until I hit 60 in season 1 (endgame) and then I continued playing it, still hated it. I kept playing for some reason, polished my skill a little, and as I got better the game became more fun, having one of the best combat systems/boss fights/classes(characters) than most games to date. It is rewarding if you dump a lot of time into it, if you're looking to display skill and experience in an mmo this game is almost perfect for it.This game is pay to win, but you can succeed without spending a dime(still should probly spend like 5$ every once in a while on megaphones to sell loot). They do have events that cater to the community and help you out every couple of months, its pretty nice. this game has so many problems, glitches and bugs If I went through them all I would be writing a trilogy novel, some lotr tier ♥♥♥♥. So I won't, i'll just say don't play this game unless you value unique high quality combat and boss fights enough to look past a mountain of garbage.tl;dr this game is like eating a 10 layered cake of ♥♥♥♥ and dirt, but in the middle layer there's a chocolate you've never tasted before thats either amazing or just another chocolate to you.

												I love this game but there are problems that hinder this game. Warframe does a better job at handling farmable items, where in Vindictus it's next to impossible.1. By the time you hit level 60 you will start to feel that the game is a freaking grindfest. GRIND GRIND GRIND GRIND GRIND GRIND. But even if you do grind you're still not going to get the items you need to have in order to even do anything. Might as well waste your in game money on a weapon or armor piece in the maarkeplace for like 990,000,000 gold. ( I literally saw an item like this on the marketplace). 2. Farming is so damn tedious you will feel so bored just doing the same stuff over and over again for hours on end. and then when you finally get the damn item you need, GUESS WHAT!? You need 10 more of them because screw you. This seriously feels like farming for Proof of Concords from the silver knights at Anor Londo.3. Your weapons blow the hell up or have a decrease in durability when you upgrade them over +3. Oh but even worse is when it resets the enhancement level back to 0. making all of your hard work for nothing. Wasting your damn time trying to enhance the weapon.4. Booses are rediculous. They have terrible hitboxes, you can't move out of there way unless you're 50 million miles away from them because there whole damn body becomes a hitbox. early on this gets really annoying. Especially when your facing the Kobolds, Yetis, or even worse the Goblins and Gremlins at the Formorian base. You will be so annoyed when they hit you a million times over and die over and over. Having to restart the mission over because of some stupid hit. 5. the items in the game are wayyyyyyyy to expensive. 990,000,000 for a single item. ARE YOU SERIOUS!!! Nobody has that type of money unless you're a botter, or you buy dye ampoules all day and selling them on the marketplace. 6. you can get kicked out of raid if you dont have good damage. if youre not over 16k in damage you're getting kicked the hell out of the boat because you didn't spend enough money enhancing your weapon or armor. and trying to get the best gear so you can have fun. 7. Costumes in the cash shop costs 20 freaking dollars. and for limited ones which look exactly the same it will cost you double that. you can also buy runes to make sure your weapons don't break at all or reset, or buy enhcant runes so your weapon doesn't become a piece a  crap.Edit: So I was really frustrated as hell while writing this review. So after I came back to my senses I realized some of the points are sort of wrong and just straight stupid and I could make them much better and much more coherent, but I'm to lazy to even do it.

content:
, 2015
												The combat and gameplay are freaking amazing. You even have to time your potion drinking in order to get the full benefit of the potion.When you get hit, it's your fault, everything is dodgable for every character. (although it is definitely harder for some classes)Or it's because of lag...Before it was on steam, I probably had 800+ hours.I had 5 classes at level 70.This game inspired me to study to make my own game.Because I have yet to find anything close to the gameplay.The closes thing so far was the Dark Souls series, but it's combat is relatively slow compared to Vindictus.I don't recommend this game because of the community you have to endure to play it.So many trolls and elitists.You HAVE to sell things on the forums to make money to get better gear.And you NEED better gear in order to get into better raids that drop better items.It becomes very pay2win in the end game.The servers suck. So when your party leader disconnects from a daily raid, it can ruin your entire run for that day.And it happens often.But if you are into game design and you like cool mechanics on bosses you should definitely check out some of them.Here's a list I recommend if you choose to try the game.Area > Dungeon > Boss-Ruins of Sanctity > Hidden > Giant Spider-Ainle > Shadowed by Darkness > The Blood Lord-Hoarfrost Depths > Irukul > Irukul-Fomorian Base > The Giant > Titan-Sewers > The Dark, Dank Sewers > Thor-Ortel Castle > Alghan the Golem > Alghan-Ortel Castle > The Central Garden > Ingkells-Catacombes > Avatar of Destruction > Glas Ghaibhleann-Albey > Betrayal > Controlled Black Hammer-Albey > The Evil One > Lionotus-Albey > Colru the Golem > Colru (easily one of the coolest fights if no trolls are on your team. 8-man raid gets split up into 4 groups of 2 to fight 4 parts of Colru, it's pretty awesome)-Heide > Earthborn Seal > Siglint-Heide > Fostborn Seal > Beokros-Heide > Timeless Rage > ElchulusAlthough all the Heide dragons have basically the same movesets and different skins, they each have their own different mechanics you need to work around to defeat them.And there's the Kraken, similar to Colru, but the team gets split up into 5 group, Not really split up physically, but everyone has their own Kraken limb to concentrate on, or the whole ship gets crushed and everyone dies. Which is pretty neat.

content:
er 15, 2014
												TL:DR - Introducing Vindictus: Brought to you by Nexon. A company that lures players with FREE to play games             but eventually you'll give into temptation and spend a ton of money -cough Pay2win-             NOT for fun. If you want to have fun, I suggest you play something else and stay away from NEXON. First we have to pick a class/character to start, 9/10 players would ignore the big black guy. Let's pick a girl, while we're at it, why not make her look attractive and sexy. (Definitely not trying to hit on guys online)Let's start with character customization, you pay for your hair and underwears, Deal with it. 10/10 would enlarge boobs to maximum. The more pixels you have, the better.Let's play the game now, level 1 to level 40. Basic training and learning the foundation of your character's move sets and skills, do the same maps over and over again and you finally do some quest to get transformation.(You're very likely to play by yourself until level 60)Now level 40-60, you've learnt how to kill mobs in a few clicks of the mouse and bosses are re-models of every single mob you see and they're either bigger or have different colours.The real challenge lies in raiding, like any MMORPG would lead you to.             I LIED.The real challenge is within the community.Most of you would quit before level 30 realizing how boring grinding can be. Otherwise, allow yourself to beintroduced to the community, visit channel 1 for all the emotional dramas.Embrace yourself to:Poverty - buy some gold, buy some nx, empty your wallet and credit card, what is life? vindi is life.Bragging - 400 titles! such is life, +15 level 80 items, majestic as osama bin laden. Bombing raid bosses with dem DEEPS.Envy - What OP players have is what you want, what you want is what leads you to poverty.Autism - Learn to deal with people that are autistic, you cannot learn from anywhere else better.Cancer - What you get if you can't deal with autism.Harrassment - Bad at something? Said something wrong? Did nothing? You get it no matter what you do.Depression - What you get when you finished the game and realized how much time and money you've spent.Anger - Proudly brought to you by Nexon, sponsored by pay2win players and trolls. Back to raids, attack requirement boats, isolated from raid parties, no invites? Congraulations you have hit the dead end of Vindictus. At this point, it's time to pluck your money out of your wallet and shove it up Nexon's butt hole.-Buy some AP -Buy some gachapon boxes-Buy some runes to enhance and enchant-Buy some gold while you're at it, everyone knows you're poorLevel 60-85, you grind between repetitive dungeons and raid bosses in order to gear up and do newcontents. At this point, you should be asking yourself, what's the meaning of all this grind?We all have fun in the games we play, we all want the strongest items in game and want to be known for achieving and looking fabulous. If you don't think you've had enough of that, enjoy wasting moretime and money refining your character that'll eventually make yourself ask the same question above.Otherwise congraulations, you've finished the game. Regrets... too late. Literally a dungeon's name that warned youbefore Level 60 contents where you may resort to spending money.10/10 recommending 12-16 year old players, autistic rustled jimmies and cancerous trolls.

content:
9, 2015
												As a person who frantically searched for a good hack and slash MMO I thought I had finally found a slice of heaven in Vindictus. It's very interactive and requires you to be attentive and think on your feet in fights, lest your enemies best you. Additionally, the character design and physics engine are quite unique for a free-to-play game.Unfortunately, there are several things keeping Vindictus from being a good MMO; the pay-to-win feature being in first place. To elaborate a bit, the first thing that comes to my mind is the 'inner armor' feature, where your character can be fitted with customizable undergarments that is worn under the armor. Your character is fitted with defult inner armor, but the nicest way to move on with this review, is to state that if you don't want to look like an idiot, you must purchase nexon points to buy new armor to look less foolish in the armors you pick up in the game. Inner armor is only the beginning, players can purchase 'temporary armor' which allows for any level player to rent a set of high-level armor for about 7 days, for nearly a real dollar each day, as well as items that can selected in a random lottery (purchaseable of course!) that are not necessarily usable by your character, but that also can not be sold in the in-game trading post. Finally for this topic, there are also 'bound' items; which are items that get locked to your character and make them unsellable in the marketplace or trading post. To unbind these, you must then purchase from the game store, potion stacks that may or may not have enough per stack, to unbind your item and make it sellable.  Which brings me to my next problem with Vindictus: ingame money system.The ingame money system in this game is absolutely in shambles. There does not seem to be any rhyme, reason or hierarchy for items which may be put up for sale. I have, on more than one occassion, found something as simple as cloth for sale for around 1k gold, and something that's difficult to pick up or find, on sale for 400 gold. If I check the market the next day, the cloth may have gone down to 200 gold, and the rarer item could inflate up to 3k in gold. It doesn't seem Nexon is setting any rules for these items to be sold at a minimum or maximum price, resulting in player prices that are unheard of, be they high or low. This means when you get to higher levels, paying for armor past level 54 is nearly impossible as armor inflates from around 24k per piece to 1-2 million quite quickly and weapons are even higher in price. The burden becomes real when you realize you're exchanging around 70k in gold for repairs and health potions. Not to mention that the pay rate between NPC sale rates and user marketplace rates have a very significant gap.Making money is out of the question for your first 15-20 levels; and that is no exaggeration. Nexon actually released a patch that prevented players below a certain level from gaining monetary rewards in dungeons, and to impress upon this, I would like to add that Vindictus is completely instanced; there are no open world opportunities. Now you may pick items up in a dungeon that could sell for money, but nothing noteable enough to allow you to upgrade things such as armor or weapons. Making money in later dungeons is a bit easier, but often requires quite a bit of trickery or repeat trips, which can ocassionally be fun I admit, but becomes cumbersome after the first few times you attempt it. Be that as it may, it's still very difficult to save enough money for crafting or purchasing new armor or weapons as you get higher in level, which makes doing dungeons, and more importantly raids, where the majority of your money comes from at higher levels, very difficult. In some cases, after completing a raid a certain amount of times, you completely stop gaining money from it.Speaking to dungeons, or more specifically, speaking to raids requires quite a good internet connection as you carry anywhere from 4-8 players on your back. It's often hard to find raids to join that do not require you to be well-equipped, well-backed by your internet and beginner friendly for those unfamiliar with the way they work. Additionally, Nexon does not seem to have stable enough servers for large party raids requiring 16-24 people, which can halt a player's progression completely. Rather than being stable, the player-to-server ratio is very ill-managed.Now I could go into the many other and much smaller issues that Vindictus has, such as the abismal drop rate for rare items, which is comparable to squeezing a diamond from a squirrel's behind, the stat fluxuation between armor and weapons from one level to the next, the chance meter for enhancements which fails about 70% of the time, the lack of character updates and gender locking, or even the fact that Nexon tries to make up for these issues by running events which can leave the user with a lot of useless and unsellable items to take up precious inventory space, but I think I've said enough.All of these problems, which are serious drawbacks for players who really want to enjoy the game, can be put aside to a certain degree and the game, especially when played with a good team, can be distracting and immersive in the level of fun it creates. That being said, these problems together whether they're big or small seem to be the result of a mis-managed product that eventually becomes more of an expensive toy that repeatedly breaks and requires money to fix, than a free-to-play immersive fantasy game for people to enjoy together.

content:
ry 1, 2015
												I didn't pay a single cent for this game, so I cannot complain too much. Maybe that's because I haven't reached a point yet where it's nearly impossible to do good without buying items, like most Free to Play (Pay to Win) games are. For now I am going to say "no, I don't recommend this game," mainly because I am willing to see if it will get better the more I play, but not expecting too much.As stated many times by other users, the gameplay can be boring and repetitive. I do get slight enjoyment out of slashing enemies, and some of the bosses are moderately fun, but overall the levels, A.I., story, and the world in general seem mediocre. I found myself clicking through most of what the characters were saying, and constantly wishing there was more to do (exploration, for one).This is one of those games that is often painful to play for long periods of time, but also strangely (and uncomfortably) addictive.

content:
8, 2012
												It's a free MMO with the visceral hack and slash combat system of a paid one.  The game is a lot more skill based than it is stat based, meaning you HAVE to dodge attacks, time yours well and not stand there like a moron soaking up damage like in WoW.  This MMO is anything but traditional, in both good and bad respects, the good being the aforementioned combat and the fact that you don't have to sink hours a day into the game to get stuff done.  The downside is, there's no huge world to explore, just a small hub you return to in order to recieve and complete quests.  The combat is done entirely instance-based, and much of those instances need to be repeated, so repetition WILL be there.  Finally, most machines will struggle over the ham-fisted optimisation and some players who prefer to solo their MMOs won't get very far without rolling with a party, so I highly reccomend you go into this with friends.  It's a good game though, and you've got nothing to lose in trying it.

content:
, 2014
												Vindctus has been one of few action RPG that allows pretty much crisp battle (excluding bugs) and entertaining character customization. However, the fact that such fantastic experience awaiting for new palyers is rather contained in ugly Nexon logo says more than it needs to be. Although varied play style is magnificant and suits probably most of players but it should be recognized that there are too many classes that intefere each other; especially when the cooperative gameplay regards dealing damage at most, the roles seem to be vague relative to killing enemies faster enough to satisfy the party. although combat is very fast-paced, it begs to force players to take in some Nexon cashes to improve--a typical Nexon ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t #1. By means I don't suggest player skill is important, but there's clear barrier between investment of "real effort" and imporvement of player skills. The way that player's attack has to surpass defense of target enemy is not-so new idea, but the way game pushes or forces you to obtain the higest number-available pretty much relies on enchantment of the weapon and armors. Enchantments DO cost alot while you also has to buy enchantment scrolls that grant special attributes. (Funny you ask, I still don't understand the point of scrolls having 7-day expiration date.As few reviewers suggested, the stories are quite enjoyable other than delivering pancakes to literally 5 meters away from quest giver, or some relying on rare-drops such as xxxx's hearts. Overall, stories are okay until you end up having to fight against raid bosses that are limited to once a day. This came to be a great problem for our friend group because the fact we all sucked as ♥♥♥♥ resulted in deliberation of the game. I honestly don't understand why the story suddenly has to put a giant barrier by forcing players to be part of raid group that require practice and understanding instead of asking higher-level players to clear. There's no clear balance between making game harder to play and making game difficult to enjoy.Third of all, as I have observed, any PvE oriented games are not suited for PvP  with few expecptions. Vindictus is one of horrid PvP gameplay sprouted from enjoyable PvE atmosphere lik a damned cancer tumor.There are many pros and errors but it's definitely one of those games you might want to try. After all, taking a bite of this juicy-action packed game does make good appeal to players. However, once the juice is all dried out, there's no real reason to continue chewing on the world-class flavor of Nexon. Whether you want to continue or not is totally up to your taste buds.

content:
er 22, 2014
												PRO:Great graphicsFast-pacedCON:Requires to spend real money to show more skinToo many Chinese players using VPNShady people with picky requirements for raidsConstant server delaysCustomer support doesn't exist (Unless you spend over $100)Long review:This game is Pay-to-Win (P2W), if you don't have enough attack or magic attack to filfull the requirement, you'll get kicked from the party, and the horrible peer-to-peer connection. The game is slowly dying, due to the people's desire for inner armors for female characters, Nexon wanting you to spend real money, power hungry people, and Nexon's horrible, horrible game server and customer service (Since when did they have customer service?), you'll get lagged every minute or so randomly. Once you get yourself from level 1 to level 60 (Or 70), big boy raids are here. There are boats that wants party members to have the defense and/or attack required to get the raid go smooth as drinking an Iced Strawberry Brandy, but that's like last year or so, not sure how it is now. Not many people hosting raid boats now a days. Even when you do get in a raid boat, you just hope the host's connection is good or you'll be getting bad lag from the host itself, since it's Peer-to-Peer connections, not directly from the server. People can leave the party whenever if you're hosting if you have bad connections with them. You'll mostly be connected with people with three bars of connection (Most of the players are from China).There is false advertisement when choosing a character to play as. Hot character showing lots of skins? Nope, you get a white overall instead of showing lots of skins. You'll be starting out with an inner armor that can only be changed by purchasing new hot inner armor with real money for $10 permanently, around half price for 30 days. Don't like the basic hair you can only choose when starting off? Better give them money to change it, around $8 for permanent or around half for 30 days. It's almost "Freemium" tier.Nexon wants you to spend NX for item shop badly. For say, you have a +5 equipment and want to go +6, but you fail regardless with the gamble of enhancing and goes back down by 1 level each. Got to +7? Want to +9? Hope you have enough material and money to afford the cost of the rank resets. The success rate for enhancement is extremely bad. There's a better solution to use protection rune to protect your equipment from losing it's enhancement. but for a cost of real money. And it's pricy for one protection rune, save money and your sanity (Not really) by buying a bundle of 5 for a pricy discount. There's also "avatars" that looks nice for characters, but for $20, it does add addtional minor stats too. Everything is expensive in the game with real money.People are too "power hungry" for stats, so they would spend real money to just be the strongest, but no knowledge of how to play the game itself. Ever since Nexon released the Ability point capsule that gives 1000 points, people really can't play the game from what I'm seeing. They have the attack and defense, but the execution is terrible. It's almost like, all talk but no show. Even an experienced player that has low attack and low defense can beat raids.Nexon's customer service horrible. There was a Q&A long time ago, not sure if people can find it again, saying they will answer your "ticket" if you spend enough NX on them. Not paying NX means they won't answer back from whatever you submitted to them. The server is usually lagging for some reason. They don't work on weekends either. Overall, it's bad. Nexon fanboys will try to deny the harsh reality of what they're doing to them.

												I played this game around for two years. Although I am in dormant stage with this game since I reached lvl90, I come back to play whenever there are new events, story or when I miss combat.These are pros and cons from my perspectiveSummaryDefinitely worth playing. Higer lvl you reach, funner it gets. Awesome combat and graphics, but limited conents. Not completely pay to win, if you do care about cosmetic 20$ of investment would be worth it. Good game to play once a while.pros1. Awesome combat/ graphics- Probably only reason why I still play this game once a while.- Style of combat is very different from other MMORPG games. It is not just spaming your mouse or pressing your key boards. You actually need to be skillful and thoughtful in order to play this game.2. Good cosmetic. - I know there are other games that has more cosmetic options but I think this game has pretty good varieties of outfit.3. Many different characters. -  Many different characters and their fighting styles are all different which make it very interesting to play each one. (but cons are each class ialready has fixed gender)Cons1. Closed world- You can only fight when you move into dungeons, no monsters around normal town. Very limited space and towns. (Although more towns are coming so hopefully they will expend their world)2. Limited contents- There is nothing much to do other than combat.3. High PC prerequisites- If you do not have good graphic cards or good internet, it is not worth playing4.Cash system- Not completely pay to win. But ofcourse cash helps game in cosmetic way or help people to lvl  up faster or protect your weapons from exploding when you are trying to upgrade. Again, this is optional though, if you do not buy into game company's trick you can be still as strong and look good as people who pay, it just takes longer. But I have to admit, that some money spent definately help. I would say around 20$ is enough to get all you need for game (for inner armor and hair+make up)

content:
5, 2015
												Let me be longwinded for a moment. You know that magical little title that everyone ranted and raved about once you got past the dificulty curve. Darksouls. Well this game is a lot like that. No seriously there is a surprising amount of storytelling in Vindictus. Really. Story. Chances are you'll play it for the gorgeous characters, fantastic armor, killer weapons, and ultra fast gameplay with spectacular skills. Look far enough into it and there is a rich untold story under the surface. Granted it's told a bit hamfistedly for most of it, there are some really killer moments and design choices that tell a story. The Mystery of Anile, the goddess, Ingkells, Tieve, Gwyn all memorable moments/characters. Each with there own stories.  Does this mean you should be looking for deep storyline? Until you get to around level 60 nothing really clicks. It's an unfortunate twist in the game, that requires time to get into the story aspect. While the rest of the game is really good, the story doesn't pick up to easily 20 or so hours in. It isn't, bad until then. It just isn't great. It's sort of there. Which again is the argument that was the end of games like ff13. Yet here the gameplay is good enough to keep me coming to the point where the story reaches a crecendo. Season two is fast off the heels of S1 and tells another deep and rich storyline if you're willing to look. Yet the best is yet to come with s3 coming up fast. Tomorrow no lessAs far as gameplay, assuming you maintain a stable framerate on a reasonable computer it's phenominal if a bit repetative. I recomend leveling two characters, one primary, and one durdle. It will keep you from getting bored of a given characters parameters before you start being able to seriously tweek the play style. Granted around level 40 the skills get VERY diverse and interesting.Graphics: Well crank up the settings and be in for a pleasent surprise. It's quite pretty.Story: While it starts rocky and somewhat confused, it gets really good!Gameplay: Amazing, get a good computer and enjoy.Character customization: pretty good, though could use some more options.Replayability: I'm biased, I have 600 hours...

y 23, 2015
												I played this way back when in 2011, and came back recently. I got back into the west coast server and was astounded on how much Vindictus decayed.This game suffers from the WOW syndrome to an insane degree. The majority of the fanbase is very high level and you will rarely meet low level characters which leaves you with very little to work with.You will have problems finding a party if you are a low level, and level 20 is considered very low level.You will have problems finding people to do the main-quest-madatory raid with if you are low level.So the game refuses to work with you unless you're high level and the amount of grind makes it not worth it. After all, why should someone invest so much time to even get to work with others on a regular basis? To work this hard to get into a community that has no guarantee to be welcoming or even good.The game itself is good but the community is so lopsided that newcomers might as well not bother.

content:
12, 2016
												Try it. Judge it your self. The Game doesn't really pick up till you're lvl 80'ish, so you won't get an accurate description of the game from comments alone. Many people who quit either quit to early to really experience vindictus or quit because this game is "pay to win". The only reason this game would be pay to win is if you buy gold (which is against vindictus rules) so the game it self does not implement a pay to win system, how about runes you might ask... there's events for that. Vindictus does alot of events that gives away free runes. How about vip? vip does nothing more than add stats that is barely noticable at end game content, +100 att or so when my att is 23-24k. VVIP? adds goddess graces which is totally not needed if you're in a party and or have a guild. In my opinion you can consider lvl 1-59 (Fairly easy to reach) the tutorial for this game. lvl 60 the introduction to "real raids". lvl 70 the grind of getting to end game. However I suggest not judging the game until you reach at least lvl 80 at this point since most of the content unlocks at lvl 80.

												An excellent action online game. I wouldn't call it an RPG necessarily, but it could be. If you had a bad day at work and need to brutally mutilate some monsters, this game is for you. It utilizes the Source engine for some great body physics as you slash, smash, burn and freeze your enemies. 6 different customizable characters to choose from each with a different play style. (combat styles are limited to characters and thus gender locked). The major downfall about this game is that its a free MMO, and thus can be glitchy and is prone to problems. These are not the fault of Steam or the game itself but more to do with the server issues of Nexon, which I don't feel is a very good company.

content:
30
												Vindictus is a free to play third person Action MMORPG.  It worked on Win 10, looked ok, played ok, sounded ok.   There is PVP, but it is not worth playing.  Brutal action combat using Mouse/Keyboard or Controllers.   Pick any hero from 10 choices, each with a different choice of weapons and attacks.  Heroes are gender locked, you can change the costmetic appearances of the hero you choose.  Combat is mainly using left and right attack buttons in certain orders while dodging/ blocking / countering attacks from enemy using Standard movement. Travel to  Instanced dungeons with up to 3 players, with 3 difficulties.  Level cap is 90.  Check the wiki and guides for info how to play and maybe find players in forum. CONS:- Very low population of new players. - Very hard to find people to play quests with.- Very repetitive PVE.- The camera system is a little clunky using Mouse / keyboard.Try it, if you like Action Combat games.For more info:

number of helpful: 7 of 10 people (70%) found this review helpful
content:
3, 2016
												TL;DR - Improvements abound from back when. Not without flaws, this is a definate play for anyone who likes action combat! Bring a friend!After a long time of playing this game I can finally say that recently, I've found that they have had their ups and downs, but I whole heartedly recommend this game to anyone who wants a free, fun game to play with some hard core action combat!- Cash shop items from revives to EXP boosts can now be purchased with AP (Skill points) which only requires that you play to earn.- The grind is very VERY reduced from it's old standard, making it much easier and more enjoyable to level up and reach the end game. They've done well in reducing it.- All characters are fun and have their own distinct playstyles. Choose the character you want, some are easier than others, but all are fun! Play this with a friend and have a blast, or play alone, even raiding can be done alone with ease now, thanks to a new "Easy" mode they added. If you can't find a party for a raid, you can run it Solo on easy and SMASH the boss and move forward with your quests! Or, bring some friends and smash it on higher difficulties for more loot and experience.If I were to take a step out and personally say something here, I prefer Vindictus over Tera. I do NOT PVP in either game, but I don't play either for that. I prefer the PVE (Monster killing) in Vindictus simply because the combat has more weight and meat to it. You can feel (Especially with bass) each strike.I highly recommend Vindictus now. It's fun, it's free, and there's nothing against trying it! It feels that the developers are honestly trying to adhere to the market of today, and it's something I really appreciate.If you want a score.8/10 Really fun, great with friends, SMASH EVERYTING

number of helpful: 7 of 10 people (70%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
y 25
												I've been playing Vindictus for many years even before I started using steam and was an active player until the past year. The game itself is very unique and can't be found nowhere in regards to game play, graphics, and story line but those specification in the game also can be the issues that make any player stop playing. This will be a long post.Perspective of 2016's game play:UPSIDE:- story updates have been chugging along (finally) with new content and outfits from eastern servers- smooth combat play and realistic physics, where you can affect objects inside the dungeon- server lag is occasional/rare- beautiful avatar and outfit customization - beautiful and creative combat and weapons for classes and boss monstersDOWNSIDE:- very dependent on gaming specs and internet strength for hosting, limiting players that can host, not to mention sacrificing high graphics for a smoother game play- tons of glitches and bugs visual-wise- too small of a community for my comfort- limited color options when dying outfits and choosing hair- despite having new updates, the time in between is very predictable and slow just to make enough money in a few months only to spend it and do it over again- events and prizes in between updates feels repetitive with recycled items- making money in the game is very dependent on RNG, not to mention losing money- almost after every update, there will be glitches and lag with maintenance when the game is online- certain features of the game that gets a revamp seems obsolete and/or not making sense, including the recently added class specific chat, broken friends list search/offline display, marketplace previews, and screenshot mode- a sense of community is very rare in-game, with little benefits of being in a guild and little participation in pvp and seige- there are few guides outside of the game making it harder to run dungeons with newer players (god knows if a dungeon is completed if half the party have end game gear but don't have good stats or know how to dodge)- the NX cash item shop is very pricey and a good portion use or have used NX in some point in the game- poor customer service overall, whether it is with tickets being delayed and forgotten, little compensation, or completing a request which never was done- there has been a recent controversy of banning active players for no good reason and other mistakes of mass suspending groups of people in the pastIn the end of the day, if someone wants to give this game a try, by all means I would recommend playing it just to experience the novelty of the combat, but in the long run the amount of time and money being put into this game will be determined by how motivated you are into playing this game.

content:
er 23, 2014
												Okay, so I downloaded this game with an open mind. I max leveled in tera online and got bored so I was on the prowl for a new MMO to play, and some friends introduced me to vindictus. After downloading the game, I tried to launch it and it crashed. Over. And over. And over again. The launcher REFUSED to work, let alone let me create an account. The little times it did work, it would give me error 500 everytime I would try to log in. I spent an HOUR constantly fighting with the launcher to let me log in and finally I got into the game. When I got into the game I was INSTANTLY reminded of rusty hearts. There are "classes" but instead of being called archer or lancer, they have actual names. I decided to go with the big sword dude, and was instantly thrown into the game. I was going through the tutorial mission and doing just fine, actually kinda liking the game now cause it had a pretty fun combat system. Well guess what. The game glitched and I got thrown out of the map and had to skip the tutorial mission before I was ready because I couldnt figure out how to restart the tutorial. So I had to begin the game before I knew things properly. Figuring out how to do missions was simple enough BUT OH MY GOD THE ♥♥♥♥ING MENUS.THIS GAME IS MENU CITY. I still dont understand what half the menus do, and I still have not figured out how to accept specific quests or do specific things. THERE ARE SO MANY GOD DAMN MENUS IN THIS GAME ITS RIDICULOUS. I spent a good 30 minutes fighting with the menus to see what everything does and it still ♥♥♥♥ing confuses me. I don't know how skills work, and it seems like they require gold? or ap? I dont know. I was constantly annoyed by how many menus there were and how they just intruded on everything. HOLY ♥♥♥♥ THE NPCS IN THIS GAME ARE ANNOYING. I DO NOT KNOW HOW TO SKIP TALKING TO NPCS AT ALL AND IT TAKES 400 YEARS TO LOAD EACH CHARACTERS DIALOUGE. I'm serious every time another npc decides it wants to talk it literally takes a loading screen, and the loading screen is a small little spining circle at the bottom of the textbox. This loading takes FOREVER. The character creation in this game sucks. Plain and simple. Half bad haircuts and bad body maker, half pay to win. You literally have to buy the hair. Yeah.  Gameplay gets boring and repetitive VERY FAST. with the dungeons just being rusty hearts. 4/10 really bad rusty hearts rip off.

												I am recommending this, but it still has certain problems to it.I have played Vindictus far more off steam than on steam, and I can say with certainty that this game has potential. The combat was always something I had been looking for ───── more than just hitting a hotkey and waiting for the player to do the work, also known as not needing "skill" at all.Even the graphics are quite beautiful.But, what takes away from it is Nexon. I don't agree that the community is bad, the people I've met are quite nice. But, Nexon, they don't fix any issues you report. It really takes away from the game when you have a problem and the company couldn't care less.I've also seen people say this is a pay to win, and it definitely is not. True, there are items, pets, accessories, etc., that you can buy to add to the game. But, do you have to pay to really enjoy the game? No. No, you do not.All in all, I think it's worth checking out.

content:
6, 2014
												If I remember correctly, this game is the reason I downloaded steam, and sure enough it was worth it, for a while. My play time may be deceiving, because the majority of it came shortly after I downloaded Vindictus.First off, the characters are all unique both in appearance and feeling, as well as gameplay. Great. The gameplay itself is much more satisfying than any other MMORPG I've ever played. The way you position your character, the multitude of different combos you utilize by threading both attacks and spells together literally blew my my mind with every drop of gnoll blood I splatted upon the cold, cursed ground.I love the combat mechanics in this game, and I always will-But the story is simply lackluster. It's hard to explain, because the story is there and there's really nothing wrong with it, but its execution is just bad. I'm not sure if there is a single character model for any of the NPCs in the game. The fact that you never see commander so-and-so fight ANYONE, or general whats-her-face kill ANYBODY, or any of these supporting characters DO ANYTHING, it makes you feel alone, and that makes for a very weak story.The story also suffers from sheer repetition in each level. Go through these ruins, kill these dogs, repeat. Same ruins, same dogs, repeat. OH WAIT A BO- aaaaaand it's just a big dog with a similar attack pattern abusable by anyone with half a brain.Okay new area. Icy tunnels. Goblins. Bigger goblin. Repeat. Tunnels. Goblins. Bigger Goblin. Repeat.Mind-numbing.I like this game, I really do, and I would recommend it to anyone, especially because it's free.But in summary this game is a testament as to why you cant make a game great with gameplay alone.

content:
er 12, 2014
												This has to be in one of my most favorite MMOs of all time, ive played Vindictus a lot more off-steam than on steam and what i can say is that one of it's greatest strengths is it actually improves a lot and often through updates and patches even so many years after release. To be honest, i was very disapointed in vindictus when it first launched, and about just as disapointed a year later, but when i did come back to it this summer, i felt like everything i've ever wanted in an MMO was now a part of this game.Pros: -Amazing Combat System , arguibly the best feature of the game.-Decent customization system for character and gear.-Lots of fun characters(classes) , most with 2 weapons (completely different playstyles usually).-The more you learn and the further you get, it will only intrigue you more rather than bore you like most MMOs.-Good Trademarket/auction house-Good events, rewards, freebies, etc.-Most stuff you pay for is either small boosts to exp and drop rates or just cosmetics. (unless you count the temporary mid lvl (50-60) you can buy , which you can also get from redeployment packages for free.-Absolutely BEAUTIFUL visuals, graphics, animations, characters, mobs, etc.-Lots of rich characters and stories and information to be learnt if interested (more of a con for me).Cons:-Lots and i mean LOTS of some what annoying text/chat bubbles from characters.-to level up quests are practically neccesary (that includes a lot of side quests)-The most Frowned upon part (that i havnt personally had much of an issue with) is that dungeons and instances are peer to peer connection.-Price difference of good mid-high level equips to great mid-high level equips to end-game equips is quite noticeable.-Requires some what of an actual graphic card and processor (not saying high end or even mid-tier, but you cant expect to play on an intel hd graphics or a very outdated low-end graphic card and get good frames).-underwear/underarmor sticks out of some armors and the defaults are plain white tights that can only be replaced by other under garments for real money (per character).Overall: this game might have been less fun in comparison to similar games like dragon nest, c9, diablo, etc in its earlier days, but now it outclasses them in certain different ways. i simply hope they make end game gear more approachable, let more ppl from more regions play the game, and with an actual server sided hosting system. but some of these things might just be too much to ask for. Well at least untill black desert comes out (if it's as good as the hype) this will be my goto and favorite MMO.

content:
1, 2015
												I want to recommend this game, I really do. I didnt get very far though, only to level 20 or so. The last time I played it was around a year ago, too.The main part of the game is the hack-and-slash segments with a little bit of exploring thrown in, but the fighting gets very repetitive. The stages are just recycled. They were too lazy to even change the layout most of the times. All they did was put the enemies in new spots. Leveling was very grindy. When you found a weapon better than the one you were using at the moment, you were lucky. I kept a lvl 8 or 10 weapon until I stopped playing. The fastest way to get better gear was to use the market.And now the part that turned me off the most;  account pin code. When you first started the game, you were prompted to make a pin code, so as to not have someone log into your account and delete all of your characters and stuff. The thing is though, you forget that code, forget your chances of ever playing on those characters again. I didnt bother to contact support though, seeing as how that I didnt really have a desire to play the game again.Overall, the game is good. It is just the company that ruined it. It had a very good design and a very poor execution. Like I mentioned at the top, I didnt get very far. I just couldnt push myself to grind through the repetitive levels over and over and over just to find something that had +5 damage over my current weapon.

number of helpful: 5 of 7 people (71%) found this review helpful
content:
4, 2013
												Vindictus asks; What are you willing to put up with to play a game totally unlike any other MMO out there? The gameplay is fast, fun, and has that perfect 'easy to learn, hard to master' feel to it. Grouping up with other people to take down a behemoth of a boss is one of those can't miss moments. With that said, the other aspects of the game are pretty terrible. Lag is ever present, even on high end PCs. DC's are (at least for me) near constant. Nexon's support is mediocre at the best of times. A lot of late game content is locked behind item mall purchases. This list could go on for much longer but I'll stop it now.I played Vindictus years ago and enjoyed the hell out of it. Dropped due to above reasons and came back to see if at least the preformance bugs were handled only to be disappointed. It is free to download though so give it a shot, see if it works, and enjoy what you can out of it.

content:
6, 2014
												Even with the update to make leveling easier on this game, farming is still a necesity to get anywhere without you shelling out some money (and the farming is painful in this game due to low drop rates). The characters also have enough diversity to suit most people's playstyle; a lot of the weapons unique and not-so-generic. The story isn't exactly engaging but it's adequate (I myself read the dialogue and see some humor sprinkled here and there).The main reason why I still continue to play this game is because the combat is so fun! Despite its shortcomings with a heavily chance-based enchanting/enhancing system and repetitive farming, I still recommend this game because the gameplay is enjoyable, fast-paced, and intense. That's what makes Vindictus different from other MMORPGs at the moment.Side note, however: Lag seems to be a pretty large "con" in this game. It relies on P2P (peer-to-peer) hosting for running dungeons, which is the only method of completing battles in this game (another "con"). There is also some server instability during large events.---EDIT DEC 2015---I have officially ceased playing this game because I have a backlog to clear, the endgame grind just isn't working out for me, and the pretty pixels and fast-paced combat system isn't enough to keep me playing anymore.There was an implementation of a seal shop which helped players who dedicated much of their time and effort in hopes of obtaining rare mats to craft higher-end gear. However, with the expansion of Season 3, there are more crafting components to focus on - this time with managing the grade/quality of individual materials. If you are complacent with O.K stats, this is a good thing. If you want to join elitist boats, this is not always a good thing.Developers are also stalling the possibility of adding second weapons for newer characters (Hurk, Lynn, Arisha, and Hagie) in favor of pushing out even more characters. One problem with this is that there is less variability in playstyle for the characters I have listed above. Another is that there are increasingly more alts you have to manage if you wish to level each character.In short, I'm not exactly happy with where this game is headed. Vindictus's team from Nexon NA is also a bit "distinguished" for their inability to manage bots or improve server stability.That being said, I still recommend this game. I still would recommend anyone interested to give it a try, because it is fun no matter how I look at it.However, I am no longer investing my time and energy into the game because of 1) the still largely present and unforgiving RNG element in obtaining suitable endgame gear, 2) lack of attention on newer characters in favor of producing even more new characters, and 3) Nexon NA.

content:
y 25
												My total hours here do not reflect how long I've actually played this game, I ran the nexon launcher version as well as standalone back in 2013, I wouldn't be suprised if I've clocked more than several thousand hours in this game. So why the negative review, I'll explain:Had this been a few years back, I would definately recommend this game. The combat in Vindictus is definitely outstanding and does deliver what is advertised for the most part, raids are fun and the community was not bad either. Sadly over the years, the game has deteriorated drastically in all aspects. Want to know what its like to play Vindictus in 2017?-Log in, play season 1 and 2 content-Grind to get RNG drops to finish story quests-Reach the start of season 3 only to realise you are heavily undergeared (stat jump is stupidly absurd)-Decide to use RNG to enhance weapon-Fail miserably and destroy weapon, only realising you can't restore until you reach level 90-Start grinding/farming again to try and remake your weapon from scratch-Try, and I emphasize, TRY to find a party to help you start season 3-Realize nobody will help you because you're a 'noob' | They're too busy grinding or farming for loot to sell at absurd prices-Quit, that is to say if you didn't already quit early due to the game breaking bugs and heavily unbalanced characters.While the game has a lot of potential, it is poorly managed by the notorious Nexon NA who are already known to only care about pushing players into using Nexon Cash, just look at some of their recent events. If you want to get anywhere in the game, or just want to make your character a little more personalized, be prepared to pay for it with cash. The game is running on an outdated source engine, poorly optimized and can barely reach a stable 60 fps even on high end rigs. The devs only seem to like pumping out content on top of content rather than addressing problems that a lot of players complain about and when confronted, they'll say thats how the Korean version is running which is outright false. The game runs a flawed anti-cheat system, BlackCipher, known for triggering false positives leading to bans while continuously scanning RAM until triggered, chewing up a hefty amount of CPU performance. I won't touch on the other topics such as p2p hosting and non-existent pvp due to unbalanced characters since a handful of other reviews have already explained how it works so I'll leave this review with this:Playing Vindictus at the moment is a matter of either reaching near endgame, unable to progress due to repetitive RNG gear farming, not being able to find help then quitting or being banned by the faulty BlackCipher.

content:
y 5, 2016
												I only merged my Nexon account with Steam so I can use my Steam Wallet, so this isn't some prematurely written review. I have a reasonable amount of experience with the game (4 characters over 75 and many above 50). With that being said I'll start with the pros, or what made it attractive FOR ME. The combat is simply amazing. It's fast paced yet fluid and responsive, versitile yet easy to learn. The reason why I stuck with the game for so long was because I wanted to try out every character's skills (with my favorite being Lann). You will rarely find a game with combat as action packed as Vindictus. Although it is instance based, Vindictus does a good job of making sure that the environment does not get too bland. Doungeons are has enough differences that you will never feel like you're just doing the same level again (with very little exceptions). This is achieved with difference in themes, maps (of course), traps (and not too many of them), and interactive elements. Now, the factors that made me quit.The story. It's pretty engaging and interesting... if it's your first time playing it. It follows the genderless and universal hero formula as all other one-path MMORPG storyline. No (interesting) sidequests to explorer, no extra content. The whole game is just sending you from place to place and instance to instance. The fact that you can buy almost everything with NX. If you've played old school Maplestory, you'd know about Nexon's mistake (or not since they probably milked those whales dry). In Vindictus, Nexon applies the same principle. You can buy almost anything in the game as long as you have the NX. From potions and revives to skill points and endgame gear. Yes, it is a skill based game, but think about it... being able to heal to full hp almost instantly, reviving without penalty, and all the damage boost. When I bought my first skill capsule (skill points), I thought to myself... "wow all those hours wasted grinding dailys was kind of pointless." I immediately lost a bit of passion for this game. Overally, for me, it's worth the first playthrough. It's something to pick up during your one week break and then let go as soon as something better comes up.

y 20, 2016
												All I can say is the combat system can be fun and the story is alright. But that's about it.The game is plagued by gold sellers which has in turn caused an incredibly inflated economy on trade materials revolving around the crafting/enhance system. When you can buy 100million gold for $13 and then buy all the trade materials off the market place...yeah...I've already earned close to 1million gold by just selling trade materials and haven't even reached level 15. Some trade goods go for about 100,000g each, while some weapons and gear sell for about 1,000g.On top of that, this game runs like trash. It's an unopimitized heap of trash. HUGE framerate spikes. Stuttering from anywhere about 10fps to 40fps in an area as you simply stand there...makes no sense and is incredibly frustrating.On top of it all, the dungeons and enemies can become incredibly bland and boring as there is very little to zero variety. In the end, the combat system is the only thing it has going for it.

												PROS+slick combat that is genuinely fun+great art syle+smooth graphics+lots of graphic options+solid mechanics+very pleasing mission systemCONS+pay2win+crippling lag (ive tried the game on multiple internet connections both wired and wifi with the same results)+extremely boring story, its all text based which you may enjoy but it more or less got in the way for me+terrible menus +confusing item and loot system**although the list of cons is short they are so prevelent that it WILL get in the way of enjoying the game**its a true shame, this games conbat is down right fun, it looks gorgeous, has a sweet art style, and to me the part that really grabbed me was the smallest detail... the lobby system heh, its really nice to prep a mission and have a space to move your character around in while you wait for your friends who take forever (friends dont make anything quick) theres a shop and items to bash around with the fantastic combat and skill system. but Nexon wants to make sure and ruin your fun, with the most god awful lag, terrible menus, and very basic tutorials to go along with them. this isnt quite EVE levels of spread sheet menu work but damn it comes close. if youve ever played a nexon mmo your going to notice striking similarities, items that have expiration dates (use this armor/wep/trinket for 7 days and then its gone) and a heavy lean on buying things it is an absolute pay2win.

content:
, 2014
												First, I played several hours prior to the arrival of this game on steam. It is a good and enjoyable game without a doubt. The gameplay is nice, the progression too, graphics are nice and all. So, why no reccommend it? Easy to say. Nexon have little to none support. you spend money in the game, you might or might not get what comes with it, what you will surely get is no answer from their part. Good features - Great gameplay, varies depending on the character and weapon type. - Graphics are nice. - Music isn't bad, not great but it's enjoyable. - Story is brought in a more Japanesse way, which isn't bad, but don't expect big cinematics as the story is more textual.Bad features - Customer support is a myth (I heard that a few people could get an answer from their part, but I never got any) - Real money spent in the game might end up split into two different pool of currency making you unable to buy the stuff you put money in for. (That is if you get some in-game currency for that hardly gained real money) - Servers are often buggy and/or down - There is a lot of connection issue known with this game.  - Hacking is a common ground around Nexon account (or so it seems, I actually got my main character's gear stolen, but I used a not-too-secure password, otherwise this point is more about what I've read on the community forums of Nexon at the time I tried to get my money back for a purchase that they did not give what was paid for). Verdict : It is a game to try, but never to invest real money in.

content:
ber 7, 2015
												This game makes me want to rip the skin off my face and eat it.... Pretty sure that would be more fun and better use of my time than it is.Now that we've got that out of the way.....I played this game a lot before it was on steam, I had no money at the time and a friend that loved it to death.He got me playing it to pass the time, as I had nothing better to do and and my aforementioned activity had not yet occurred to me, I went for it.At first glance the game seems alright, a nice cast of characters, a mediocre customization menu, the game doesn't look too shabby graphically, and it was free.Then I started walking.... The animation was smooth, so smooth in fact that I seemed to be sliding my feet along the ground, only moving about half as fast as my animation suggested I should be.. So I turned and ran to the left and I glided along in a way that could almost be compared to a cat trying to gain traction on a recently waxed floor, I mean I did turn, just not in the way one might expect a human to move across dirt and grass.I got to a combat section and because thought to myself "This is where the game will redeem itself!!" but I was Let down by this as well! It's by no means awful, but in my eyes it was typical, it didn't do anything I hadn't seen before and the execution of the system didn't wow me either, It lacked polish.That's when things started getting weird, suddenly I noticed that my character's physics would randomly spaz out while I was standing still, parts of her armor and/or body would jolt around like a kid who's had too much sugar. And I would randomly become stuck at odd angles against terrain during combatLets move on from all of that though.I feel like I should mention a few more things that struck me as odd... There are more loading screens in this game than you can shake a stick at. You wanna go to the docks where you access the missions? Loading screen! You wanna start a mission? Loading screen, which then leaves you on a tiny dock with a boat on it. You wanna start the mission for real this time? Loading screen!!!!! Just when you think that's all of 'em done, you kill a few baddies and walk a little ways... LOADING SCREEN!!!! I think you get the picture... The camera controls are shockingly sluggish for an ARPG.They call it an MMO, it's not an MMO it's a Co-Op multiplayer ARPG with a giant chat room where you can find up to 4 players to run missions with you.You need to use real money for most of the cool looking stuff.TLDR: The game claims to be things it isn't. It's not an awful game it's just a huge let down.If you like the concept of this game play Warframe, or nearly any other ARPG instead. (I mention Warframe only because it's similar to this game)If you think this review is unfair, feel free to dislike it. We're all entitled to our own opinions.P.S. Shortly before writing this I redownloaded the game on steam and nothing has changed.

content:
y 2, 2015
												Been playing this game on and off for 3 years now. Here is what i have to say:Game itself is fantastic and actually fairly challenging to master. Many people have mentioned the sharp learning curve in raids, and I won't deny it does take effort, time and practice to get used to each boss, but in my honest opinion that's what makes this game unique and awesome. It is not a simple brainless point and click adventure like most other MMOs out there but actually takes quite a bit of skills to play well. You actually feel good after beating something. This is one of those games that defense is not that important once you can master it. In a nutshell, raids/raid bosses are where this game is mostly at. You do raids, gather seal of braveries and craft lv70 gears which would allow you to join those silly attack boats in Season 2. Acquiring 12 seals a day is perhaps the most efficient way to get gears up to speed, so you can have enough stats to do kraken and lakoria for their drops. You can choose to farm, but that is imho very time consuming and not worth the return you'd get. Instead, play 1-2 hours a day with a guild, run the raids of your choices + lakoria and kraken (mandatory, they are easy raids with valuable drops) and grab all the seals on all the characters you can.Since I mentioned characters, let's just say some characters are more powerful than the others. Certain character in this game has been pretty bad since 2011 and is still pretty bad lel. (aka that male character everyone thought was so cool holding 2 swords and looked like he would decimate everythng in this game but turned out he was the one who always got decimated for making 1 mistake huehuehue), and certain characters are a lot harder to gear up to the attack boat requirements. What I recommend is to roll one of these characters as your first character for now (in order of most recommended to least: hurk/arisha - kai - vella - lynn - Karok/evie/Fiona) and wait for the dual-sword character buff coming (test server in KR for now). The ones I listed are pretty fun as they are actually, and should keep you busy for a long time. So, to fully enjoy this game, I recommend:1). Spending enough to make a good weapon that can bring you up to 15-16k attack. How good the weapon has to be is up to you. I'd say to do end game lv80 dungeons, a +10 lv70 nighthawk is perhaps the best option for most people before they get hold of a lv80 weapon. They are good cheap weapons and very easy to make. Doing this is to join all these stupid S2 attack requirement boats.2). Have a decent computer to be able to run this game at 60fps in DX8. Otherwise you will not get the most out of it. Hardware from 2011/2012 is more than capable of this. Recommend an intel processor because this game hates AMD processor. OPTIONAL: if you choose to host 8-man dungeon, make sure your internet is at least 2mbps upload, in addition to meeting the 2012 pc requirement. 3). Overlook the bad things Nexon does, and take full advantage of good things they do.What I mean by this is that we all know how Nexon works as a company if you have played any of their games, and you can QQ as loud as you can, but every now and then they do some events and all that which are actually good for the players, and you don't wanna miss those just because how much personal grudge you hold against them. Things like giveaway, events etc. are for us, and we need to get all of them. Meanwhile get on forum and QQ/vent all you want when something goes wrong, because some of these issues have been there for YEARS and still not completely fixed. Cough cough server hamsters etc. 4). Avoid rolling a dual sword character as your first character for the reason I have described above. 5). Avoid too much farming for reason I described above.6). Focus on the gameplay and raid boss fights. Treat it as an action game and work on how you can improve and do better.

content:
ry 20, 2016
												Alright, so this is a revisit of my old review because I feel like I was way too hard on the game.Now, lets talk about Vindictus.Vindictus is an F2P MMO made by the infamous Nexon gaming company.You take on the roll of one of many classes, following the story of a mercenary (you) who is on the hunt to figure out why the fomors are attacking the humans.GameplayFrom a purely gameplay standpoint, the game is great. The combat is quite possibly the most fun combat system out of any mmo I've played (dating back to early WoW). It's all about timing and using your abilities to exploit your enemy and their weaknesses.It can get a little hard later on as end-game content heavily relies on your spending real life cash to upgrade your weapons. Some people have spent upward of $500 just to upgrade a set of items ingame.You were warned.Artistic stylings/Graphics/Designs/Story developmentIn all fairness, they have a decent story going on. I'll summarize the story in a spoiler at the end of this section so if you don't want to see it, don't scroll over the black bars.Character design is a major part of the game for many people. While there are events to get free innerwear and/or cosmetic outfits (that do give slight bonuses), it requires you to spend real money. Almost everything "fun" costs you real money.A typical set of standard clothes can cost you $10-$30 depending on where you live.The graphics and the cleanliness of your hud, character icons, etc. are all really well done.The game is pleasing to the eyes, and you can adjust the settings for these to either be ultra-highres or dumbed down to the point that a toaster oven could play it.As for the story, I'd love to see where they are going with it. You currently follow the life of your mercenary who helps the mercenary outpost find out why the fomors are attacking. Eventually, you join the Royal academy in Rocheste.Things then take a turn for the worst. Along your crusade to stop the fomors, you find out that your friend is actually the Oracle. The fomors are fighting you because if your Oracle finds her powers, the fomors die.The fomors want to use the Oracle to kill the humans.Race wars, basically.Then, upon the return of the Oracle, you lose your memory. All your friends who died, people you meet, etc.Everyone forgets you and you forget them. However, time is reverted but the casualties are there.Now, you are a pirate. You go out, do missions, and along the way you find the "spirit stone" (I think).One problem, it's a human and her brother Milo betrays you after she sacrifices herself to save her brother.Now, you forget everything AGAIN.You head out with your mercenary group to protect Rocheste against the attack of one giant fomor, Muir, who you literally ride up the Rocheste castle and attempt to kill in a battle of epic proportions.Why I wouldn't reccommend this game.I know what you're thinking "this doesn't sound so bad, so far it's been mostly good parts about the game in this review".Well, buckle up because here's where I throw you a curveball.Nexon is terrible.Absolutely trash.They force you to use a launcher that not only slows the game and is prone to memory leaks, but they use an "anti-cheat" that can ban you for literally anything. Itunes, your own antivirus calling Nexon Anti-Cheat a virus, or that time you forgot to turn your Razer macros off.Aside from that, you're not allowed to help new players.At all.People used to make guides and youtube videos for the noobies but as of recently, Nexon will ban you from both their forums and the steam forums (RIP Morgianna). Nexon is like the Nazis of gaming, if you don't like when they randomly decide to slap you in the face then that's too bad because they'll ban you before you say anything they don't like.Aside from that, all the major aspects of this game will require you to spend real cash on items that are way too damn overpriced. Maybe it's just NexonNA, I don't know.In order to do end-game or high level content, you need to upgrade your weapons and abilities. It's not an option.After upgrading something (excluding abilities) three times, your item has a change to PERMANENTLY BREAK.Meaning your item is gone forever and is only retrievable by spending more AP than physically possible to get in the game (meaning you'd need to BUY CAPSULES TO GET IT BACK).THE BIGGEST POINT OF ALL RIGHT HERE BECAUSE I'M STILL DUMBFOUNDED OVER THIS.Here's a story that should tell you just how Nexon cares about you.Max level GM (Game-Manager AKA Nexon Employee) gets on the game.No items, no innerwear, stock Karok.They go to Channel 1, the main channel where everyone is spamming gold sites and where most people hang out.They drop "premium bath soap" in the hotsprings."But what's wrong with that?"What's wrong with it is the fact that I followed him from the Inn of Colhen - where there were 4 bots spamming gold sites for free Nexon cash and gold - all the way to the hotsprings where there was one person (level 82) spamming the Megaphone channel (people all over the game in all channels can see that chat at all times) with - you guessed it - A GOLD SITE LINK...Nexon legitamitly doesn't care. They would rather slow your game, damage your computer, and ban you for helping a new player rather than ban gold spammers and bots that flood their servers.*As of writing this, the guy spamming megaphone chat with a gold site still exists. Three months later.( •᷄ὤ•᷅)？

content:
, 2016
Product received for free
												It's been almost four years. Four years of endless raids, failed enhancements, countless revives, and $10 hair. Vindictus is a great game, don't get me wrong. The combat system is like no other; it's not just a point-and-click adventure, it's a time-based, active style of playing. There is plenty of stuff to do as well, such as improving your expertise, building and getting the best gear, getting 500+ titles, helping out your guildmates, waiting for the Korean updates to come to NA, dressing up your female characters ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°), spending millions on dyes for your armor and outfits because you need to have that ＡＥＳＴＨＥＴＩＣ, destroying your weapon while attempting to get +15 and crying afterward, and more! There are currently 11 classes (some of which have alternate weapon choices), which makes for a variety of playing styles. If you ever get bored, just make an alt! Although the character creator is not as advanced as BDO's or other MMOs, you can still have fun with it, and make your characters really ♥♥♥♥ing fat, like really huge, it's funny (and I'm terrible.).If you enjoy being a meat shield, then you will like Fiona.If you love K-Pop, than you will looooooove Sylas.If you like shooting ♥♥♥♥ from far away because you are a pansy, then you will like Kai.If you like having two swords because one is not enough for you, then you will like Lann.If you don't like Lann because he's a dude, then you will like Vella.If you love big breasted women with magical swords, then you will like Arisha.If you are into big, meaty, dark, muscular men, then you will love Karok.If you like barely-legal girls, then you will adore Lynn.If you are into girls, and magic, and by extension magic girls, then you will dig Evie.If you like dudes that need phallic compensation, then you will enjoy Hurk.If you like striping in your combat, then you will like Delia.Overall this game is really fun, especially with friends, and also a huge waste of time; it's great! Oh and the bots actually help the economy stay stable, go figure!

content:
er 6, 2014
												Now, I've played a lot of MMO's over the past 8 years or so, mostly fantasy RPGs. Within the past 2 it has been surprisingly hard to find a solid contender for the "Action RPG", as I thought they would become more popular. I've been seeing nothing but, attempt, after attempt, of companies trying to produce an action oriented combat system, all but a select few falling very short of what I would consider polished, and functional. I played in the original release of Vindictus up until Evie was released, and picked it back up shortly after Kai was released.  The beginning was rough, with few characters, and the mission limits, with a token system that forced players to pay actual money to play more than a couple missions a day. However, now that stuff is gone, and what I see, and experience is a truly thought out, polished, and challenging combat system, that cannot be found in any other MMO out there. It is on par, and in some cases better than single player, full price fantasy RPGs. However, there are still major draw backs that prevent me from recommending it to everyone.  One; the way the game is set up, it forces players to go through one of the longest, and cruelest, grinds of any game I've ever played. By having all of the cool, and unique adventures restricted now, but not last March, to being level 50 or over. Many new players go in to try out this cool game, but are forced to drag themselves through repetitive areas, and a story that no-one is going to read,(Trust me, I tried), just to get to maps that are unique, and drastically more polished parts of the game. It's like giving someone a game, and saying, "These first 50 levels are just a test, to see if you're worthy of the good stuff". On a positive note, those forced 50 levels are fantastic practice, so you aren't likely to be terrible on your first major raid. I just don't understand the decision to increase the level restriction for the big raids in Malina.  Two; even though it has been said numerous times, the utter lack of choice a player has when making a character without paying a little for a hair style, or inner. It's brilliant business wise, I understand, but character customization is  huge factor to an increasingly large amount of MMO players. The simple lack of variety in new characters is a huge turn off, and a reason I can't give this game a perfect pass. Now, I've spent well over a few hundred dollars on this game, simply because I love it, and I'm invested into the characters I've spent over 500 hours with. When it comes down to it, there is a large audience that will give this game a shot and dwindle away shortly after reaching level 20 or so, since there isn't much to do, very few will continue on to actually play the "game".  In the end, Vindictus is a game that gives players an unparalleled action RPG experience, it may take a long time to dive into, but once you've past your "test", you'll likely never find another FREE* MMO that gives you a truly ambitious, and thrilling combat experience.

If you decide to play it, then just don't expect much. This game is designed to take a very long time to obtain items, whether they be weapons or armor, and it's also designed to nearly force you to spend money on it in order to protect your gear from potential failed enhancements or enchants, both of which can destroy your items. Anyway, I'll end this review.  That's it.
